text: The United States Secretary of Health and Human Services is the head of the United States Department of Health and Human Services, concerned with health matters. The Secretary reports to the President of the United States. The Secretary is a member of the President's Cabinet. ==List of secretaries== ; Parties (9) (15) (2) Status ===Health, education, and welfare=== No. Portrait Name State of residence Took office Left office President(s) President(s) Texas April 11, 1953 July 31, 1955 (1953–1961) New York August 2, 1955 July 31, 1958 (1953–1961) Ohio August 1, 1958 January 19, 1961 (1953–1961) Connecticut January 21, 1961 July 13, 1962 (1961–1963) Ohio July 31, 1962 August 17, 1965 (1961–1963) Ohio July 31, 1962 August 17, 1965 (1963–1969) California August 18, 1965 March 1, 1968 (1963–1969) Michigan May 16, 1968 January 20, 1969 (1963–1969) California January 21, 1969 June 23, 1970 (1969–1974) Massachusetts June 24, 1970 January 29, 1973 (1969–1974) California February 12, 1973 August 8, 1975 (1969–1974) California February 12, 1973 August 8, 1975 (1974–1977) Alabama August 8, 1975 January 20, 1977 (1974–1977) District of Columbia January 25, 1977 August 3, 1979 (1977–1981) District of Columbia August 3, 1979 May 4, 1980Harris was Secretary on May 4, 1980, when the office changed names from Secretary of Health, Education, and Welfare to Secretary of Health and Human Services. Because the department merely changed names, she did not need to be confirmed again, and her term continued uninterrupted.
